file_content.text: I've seen thousands drop dead from Tarisian Toxic Flu. Watched cities vaporize from proto-isotope bombs. Nothing like this. Thought it would be dead silent.
"Humanitarian crisis," says the Republic. But what about us droids?
My field of expertise is in the biological sciences. Yours?
Hazardous services. Approved for Class Nine unstable isotopes and species-neutral catastrophic pathogens.
You aren't carrying any of those things around with you...?
You don't have the clearance for that information. Hey, you know anything about what's going on here?
Like I'd tell you if I did.
What about us? Need a spinal upgrade there, professor.
I don't know about you, but I'm not serving any purpose standing on the outskirts of a war zone. I'll be shot to scrap, and what good will that do?
Give me a good laugh, at the very least.
You're awful.
There's this bacteria in my databanks--connects all its hosts into a single mind till there's nothing left for it to infect. Then it dies.
Does it say what happens to the life forms?
They don't die, but they don't really know they're alive anymore.
Fascinating. I'd like to study them sometime.... I don't imagine what happened to them is what we're seeing here.
Agreed. This is... something else.
I've surveyed virtually every landscape imaginable in search of life. There's always something to hear--sometimes agreeable, sometimes not.
Should look for transport. Nothing of use left for either of us to do here.
I'm staying. It's not entirely dead here yet, and I'd like to conduct research.
I know death. What's out there--it's not life, I'll tell you that. But if you insist on sticking around, I can wait.
